oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fortifying of New Orleans
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Print entitled "Fortifying of New Orleans." Shows General Jackson giving orders as slaves work in the background. Engraving by William Croome. Printed in "The Pictorial Life of Andrew Jackson" (1848).
General Jackson employed citizens and slave labor to construct what became known as Line Jackson at New Orleans.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Campaigns & battles; Soldiers
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: William Croome
